physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild microcytic anemia (131 g/L) with acanthocytes; mildly elevated transaminases; serum total tocopherol 50% of normal (7.1 mol/L, normal 15–41 mol/L); vitamin E: total cholesterol ratio 1.46 (normal <2.22); serum ceruloplasmin 20% of normal (34 mg/L, normal 200 mg/L); serum copper 10% normal (1.1 mol/L, normal 11.0–26.0 mol/L); MRI of the brain showed cerebellar atrophy, most evident in the vermis; EMG revealed mild slowing of sensory nerve conduction velocities.
Serum total tocopherol obtained was 27.3 mol/L (normal). Moderate improvement in cerebellar function and gait documented after 12 months of vitamin E and copper replacement therapy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in cerebellar function and gait after 12 months of therapy.
